channel.title: Seperating 317-498 and 499-Current runescape revision
channel.description:
I myself hate any server 508 plus, and since there's such a huge difference between the revisions stated in the title, I think it would be great to separate them. A lot of people(like me) only have an interest in 1 revision, so it would probably organize the Runescape Emulation section a lot. I also don't really like opening a help thread to find it's some revision I know nothing about. There's probably more reasons, just can't think of them atm.
And since I don't think this requires another thread:
I seriously think there should be some format required to post in the Server Help section. It's so damn annoying seeing people asking questions and not even stating there base, having pics, pasting errors, or any other information that can help.
Edit2:
[url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,267609.0.html]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,267609.0.html[/url]
Haven't been seeing that enforced a whole lot, an actual layout would be awesome.

item.title: Seperating 317-498 and 499-Current runescape revision
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:15, topic:445120”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=547808.msg4017154#msg4017154 date=1339725125]
I suggested this probably around 2 years ago, and got shut down completely. I see the only solution without making the forums extremely ugly would be:

Have the main category just like it is now, but lock it so nobody can make new topics in it (and we can move/delete the current ones whenever)

Create sub boards for each group (I would suggest 317 and then 508+) in each that are unlocked.

That way it doesn’t look that much different than it does now…
[/quote]

I think I like this idea the best, that way we wouldn’t have to do a lot of moving or anything in the beginning, but new topics would naturally be filtered correctly.[/quote]Can we apply this soon? Or do we have to have a full staff discussion :P?

Read full topic

item.title: Seperating 317-498 and 499-Current runescape revision
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:7, topic:445120”]I suggested this probably around 2 years ago, and got shut down completely. I see the only solution without making the forums extremely ugly would be:

Have the main category just like it is now, but lock it so nobody can make new topics in it (and we can move/delete the current ones whenever)

Create sub boards for each group (I would suggest 317 and then 508+) in each that are unlocked.

That way it doesn’t look that much different than it does now…[/quote]

I think I like this idea the best, that way we wouldn’t have to do a lot of moving or anything in the beginning, but new topics would naturally be filtered correctly.

Read full topic

We’ve figured out the merging with the sites, what about this?

item.title: Seperating 317-498 and 499-Current runescape revision
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Just bumping this to let you know it’s still being considered. We’re currently backed up trying to figure out what we want to do regarding the merge idea, so this is a bit on the back burner. I’m keeping it open until I have something to tell you, though.

Read full topic

Any word on this?

item.title: Seperating 317-498 and 499-Current runescape revision
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Sub boards dont look ugly if they dont have long names, its just switching between the sub boards for moderating would be hard. We would have to find either one mod per client revision or one for the entire board + subs

Read full topic

item.title: Seperating 317-498 and 499-Current runescape revision
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

I don’t see how adding a new board/category or whatever makes anything more/less ugly O.o

But I really don’t care how it looks, that’s for you guys to decide tbh, I just wanted them to be seperated

Read full topic

item.title: Seperating 317-498 and 499-Current runescape revision
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I suggested this probably around 2 years ago, and got shut down completely. I see the only solution without making the forums extremely ugly would be:

Have the main category just like it is now, but lock it so nobody can make new topics in it (and we can move/delete the current ones whenever)

Create sub boards for each group (I would suggest 317 and then 508+) in each that are unlocked.

That way it doesn’t look that much different than it does now…

Read full topic

item.title: Seperating 317-498 and 499-Current runescape revision
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:4, topic:445120”]I’ve actually been waiting for someone to suggest this since I made the board.

One of the things I see is quite successful on r-s is the split layout. Nevertheless, it’s difficult to pull off without it becoming very tacky and difficult to manage. What exactly do you suggest?[/quote]

More sectional moderators I guess, if it’s going to be that hard to manage.

Or maybe make a different rank with more ability’s then a member, but less then a sectional mod?
perhaps

or

I don’t know

[quote=“Frell, post:5, topic:445120”]I support dividing up everything honestly, its the best solution to the mess. But its very hard to mod unless we have a moderator for each category.

Help should for sure be split up though.[/quote]

^^^

Read full topic

item.title: Seperating 317-498 and 499-Current runescape revision
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

I support dividing up everything honestly, its the best solution to the mess. But its very hard to mod unless we have a moderator for each category.

Help should for sure be split up though.

item.title: Seperating 317-498 and 499-Current runescape revision
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I’ve actually been waiting for someone to suggest this since I made the board.

One of the things I see is quite successful on r-s is the split layout. Nevertheless, it’s difficult to pull off without it becoming very tacky and difficult to manage. What exactly do you suggest?

Read full topic

item.title: Seperating 317-498 and 499-Current runescape revision
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Si Force, post:2, topic:445120”]I’m indifferent about the download section board split to be honest. The only problem is that if it were to occur, you’d either have to delete every single download or else sort each download into each board, both of which I’d be against doing.

@help section, The only reasonable solution I can see is asking people to tag their topic titles with [317] or whatever the revision is. A layout is a good idea in theory, but it is hard to enforce. The majority of people asking for help are new members and more often than not, they don’t read the stickied topics. For that reason, I don’t think enforcing a layout would be the best option. Just my 2 cents.[/quote]

Not just the download section, everything. I don’t think deleting every single download is really needed anyways

Maybe we can make it so when they click “start thread” the layout is already typed for them.

Read full topic

item.title: Seperating 317-498 and 499-Current runescape revision
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

I’m indifferent about the download section board split to be honest. The only problem is that if it were to occur, you’d either have to delete every single download or else sort each download into each board, both of which I’d be against doing.

@help section, The only reasonable solution I can see is asking people to tag their topic titles with [317] or whatever the revision is. A layout is a good idea in theory, but it is hard to enforce. The majority of people asking for help are new members and more often than not, they don’t read the stickied topics. For that reason, I don’t think enforcing a layout would be the best option. Just my 2 cents.

Read full topic
